unit.name: Centimeter
unit.description: A length unit which is equal to one hundredth of a meter or 10^[-2] m.

unit.name: Meter
unit.description: A length unit which is equal to the length of the path traveled by light in vacuum during a time interval of 1/299 792 458 of a second.

unit.name: Millimeter
unit.description: A length unit which is equal to one thousandth of a meter or 10^[-3] m.

unit.name: Gram
unit.description: A mass unit which is equal to one thousandth of a kilogram or 10^[-3] kg.

unit.name: Kilogram
unit.description: A mass unit which is equal to the mass of the International Prototype Kilogram kept by the BIPM at Svres, France.

unit.name: Milligram
unit.description: A mass unit which is equal to one thousandth of a gram or 10^[-3] g

unit.name: Day
unit.description: A time unit which is equal to 24 hours.

unit.name: Hour
unit.description: A time unit which is equal to 3600 seconds or 60 minutes.

unit.name: Minute
unit.description: A time unit which is equal to 60 seconds.

unit.name: Month
unit.description: A time unit which is approximately equal to the length of time of one of cycle of the moon's phases which is science is taken to be equal to 30 days.

unit.name: Second
unit.description: A time unit which is equal to the duration of 9 192 631 770 periods of the radiation corresponding to the transition between the two hyperfine levels of the ground state of the caesium 133 atom.

unit.name: Week
unit.description: A time unit which is equal to 7 days.

unit.name: Year
unit.description: A time unit which is equal to 12 months which is science is taken to be equal to 365.25 days.

unit.name: Kilogram per square meter
unit.description: An area density unit which is equal to the mass of an object in kilograms divided by the surface area in meters squared.

unit.name: Event count
unit.description: A dimensionless count unit which denotes the number of occurrences of an event.

unit.name: Fraction
unit.description: A dimensionless ratio unit which relates the part (the numerator) to the whole (the denominator).

unit.name: Decibel
unit.description: The decibel (dB) is a logarithmic unit of measurement that expresses the magnitude of a physical quantity (usually power or intensity) relative to a specified or implied reference level. Since it expresses a ratio of two quantities with the same unit, it is a dimensionless unit. A decibel is one tenth of a bel, a seldom-used unit.

unit.name: Percent
unit.description: A dimensionless ratio unit which denotes numbers as fractions of 100.

unit.name: Scale
unit.description: A dimensionless ratio unit which relates the part (the numerator) to a specified, fixed whole (the denominator). E.g. in a map, a scale of 1:10,000 may mean something like 1 centimeter on the map is equivalent to 100 meters on the ground.

unit.name: Hertz
unit.description: A frequency unit which is equal to 1 complete cycle of a recurring phenomenon in 1 second.

unit.name: Events per day
unit.description: Number of events occurring in 1 day.

unit.name: Events per hour
unit.description: Number of events occurring in 1 hour.

unit.name: Events per minute
unit.description: Number of events occurring in 1 minute.

unit.name: Events per month
unit.description: Number of events occurring in 1 month.

unit.name: Events per second
unit.description: Number of events occurring in 1 second.

unit.name: Events per week
unit.description: Number of events occurring in 1 week.

unit.name: Events per year
unit.description: Number of events occurring in 1 year.

unit.name: Pascal
unit.description: A pressure unit which is equal to the pressure or stress on a surface caused by a force of 1 newton spread over a surface of 1 m^[2].

unit.name: Cubic meter
unit.description: A volume unit which is equal to the volume of a cube with edges one meter in length. One cubic meter equals to 1000 liters.

unit.name: Liter
unit.description: A volume unit which is equal to one thousandth of a cubic meter or 10^[-3] m^[3], or to 1 decimeter.
